name: Beef Tenderloin
ingredients: 2.5-3 lb – Beef Tenderloin Roast, preferably head piece and trimmed silver skin
3 large – Shallots, halved and sliced thinly
3/4 cup – Dry Red Wine, like a fruity Cabernet Sauvignon
instructions: Position the rack to the middle and preheat the oven to 450˚F
Rub the beef with oil and place in a roasting pan lined in tin foil
Season beef generously with salt and pepper
Roast beef until rare or medium rare
Let the meat rest on a cutting board for 10-15 minutes in foil, note that the meat will rise 5˚F when resting
While beef is roasting, make the sauce:
Melt half of the butter in a skillet over medium heat
Add shallots and cook, stirring often, until they soften and turn golden brown, approximately 8-10 minutes
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat
Boil until mixture reduces to 1/2 cup, approximately 3 minutes
Add broth and continue to boil until mixture reduces to 1 cup, approximately 5 minutes
Reduce heat to low, remove sprig and stir in chopped rosemary
Cut the remainder of the butter into cubes
Add a few cubes at a time, stirring to melt each addition
Stir in accumulated juices from the resting meat
Add salt and pepper to taste
Serve sliced meat with the sauce

additional_context.tips: Beef should be: 120-125˚F for rare (~25 minutes) or 125-130˚F for medium rare (~30 minutes)
